name: too-long-line-limit
description: Create clean and readable code in Visual Studio Code.

too-long-line-limit.softLimit.markdownDescription:
This is a soft limit, which is acceptable to exceed, but negatively affects the readability of the code.

Exceeding it results in the display of a warning.

*Changing this value is not recommended, 80 characters are completely sufficient in most cases.*

too-long-line-limit.hardLimit.markdownDescription:
This is a hard limit, exceeding which significantly affects the readability of the code.

Exceeding this limit results in the display of an error.

*This limit should not be much higher than the `#too-long-line-limit.softLimit#`.*

too-long-line-limit.rulersEnabled.markdownDescription:
Used to determine whether rulers should be visible.

Their position depends on the settings `#too-long-line-limit.softLimit#` and `#too-long-line-limit.hardLimit#`.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
